thag16.6:7.5: This is of course a reference to the first sermon (SN 56.11).
thag16.6:9.1: The title “General of the Dhamma” belongs to Sāriputta (Ud 2.8:16.2, Thag 18.1:33.1).
thag16.6:10.5: Anujāta is said at Iti 74:4.1 to be a child who “takes after” the good qualities of their parents.
thag16.6:12.4: Abhiṇhaso means “repeatedly”. Here the force of the saying is, I think, “It is hard enough to encounter a Buddha even once, let alone repeatedly.”
thag16.6:16.4: The “dark class” refers to those born in an unfortunate state (AN 6.57:11.1). Sela is saying that the Buddha’s path is for everyone, not just the fortunate.
thag16.6:22.1: This verse and the next are also at Snp 3.6:49.1.
